intro: Rhexia hieracioides, commonly known as hairy willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands, ditches, and forest edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Rhexia hieracioides is often found in wet or disturbed soils and plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators.
